title: Content Acquisition Podcasts (CAPs) for Physical Education of Visually Impaired Children

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Course enhancing physical education capabilities for visually impaired children through simulation and VR-based learning in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners will be able to explain the physical characteristics and methods for assessing motor abilities of children with visual impairments.
Learners will be able to apply procedures for designing customized physical education classes for children with visual impairments using podcast (CAPs) content.
Learners will implement interaction techniques with children with visual impairments in real-life scenarios with over 70% accuracy through VR simulations.

resources: VR Simulation Software for Physical Education of Visually Impaired Children
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
